metadata.Title: CVE-2020-21675 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A stack-based buffer overflow in the genptk_text component in genptk.c offig2dev 3.2.7b allows attackers to cause a denial of service (DOS) viaconverting a xfig file into ptk format.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-21675` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

fig2dev - 1:3.2.8b-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: fig2dev package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.2.8b-1').
